Detailed Description

Timer functions.

Time event functions

  • To wait in your program, you can use the Wait_Us() or Wait_Ms() functions.
  • If you want a periodic event, you can use the Timer1 function. This function use the interrupt timer1.

timer1 event interrupt example code
        // This code example will generate a pulse signal on pin 2 of PORTE.

        UInt8 tick=0;

        DDRE=0x02; // pin PORTE pin2 is set as output 
        tick=0;

        // Init timer overflow to 7.5 ms
        Timer1Init(50536,TIMER1_8);
        
        // Main loop program
        while(1)
        {
                // Wait an overflow of timer:
                if( IsTimer1Overflow() == 1 )
                {
                        // Clock output on PORTE2: 
                        if(tick==0)
                        {
                                sbi(PORTE,2);
                                tick=1;
                        }
                        else
                        {
                                cbi(PORTE,2);
                                tick=0;
                        }
                }
        }

Typedef Documentation

typedef enum _timer1_prescaler TIMER1_PRESCALER

Timer1 prescaler enumeration.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum _timer1_prescaler

Timer1 prescaler enumeration.

Enumerator:
TIMER1_STOP  no prescaler, timer1 off
TIMER1_1  timer prescaler 1
TIMER1_8  timer prescaler 8
TIMER1_64  timer prescaler 64
TIMER1_256  timer prescaler 256
TIMER1_1024  timer prescaler 1024

Function Documentation

UInt8 IsTimer1Overflow ( void   ) 

Is the timer1 overflow?

Returns:
1 if the timer1 overflow, else 0.

void PwmTimer3Init ( UInt16  delayPinE3,
TIMER1_PRESCALER  prescaler 
)

Generate pwm signal on a input pin.

Period formula: delay = CPU Frequency / ( your period in second x prescaler ) -1

With:

  • CPU Frequency = 16 000 000.
  • Your timer in seconds.
  • Prescaler egual to 1, 8, 64, 256 or 1024.

The pwm signal is generated on PIN3 of PORTE: You have to set PIN3 of PORTE as an output pin with the SetIOWay function.

Parameters:
delayPinE3 Pwm period (see previous formula for compute this parameter).
prescaler Timer prescaler.

void PwmTimer3SetPinE3 ( UInt16  delay  ) 

Set pwm period.

Warning:
The pwm must be init with PwmTimer3Init function!
Parameters:
delay New pwm period.

void PwmTimer3Stop ( void   ) 

Stop pwm timer3.

void Timer1AttachFunction ( void(*)(void)  Process  ) 

Attach a function to timer overflow.

The function will be called at overflow of timer1.

Parameters:
Process User function
Attach function example
  // This code example call the MyProcess function at overflow of timer1.

  void MyProcess(void)
  {
                //all the 7.5 ms, this function is runing at timer1 overflow
  }

  void main(void)
  {
                // Init timer:
                Timer1Init(50536,TIMER1_8);

                // Attach a function to timer1
                Timer1AttachFunction(MyProcess);

                while(1)
                {
                        // Main loop
                }

  }

void Timer1DetachFunction ( void   ) 

Detach a function.

void Timer1Init ( UInt16  delay,
TIMER1_PRESCALER  prescaler 
)

Init timer1 interrupt.

The timer1 will overflow when your delay is off.

How to compute the delay parameter:

Delay parameter = 65536 - Your Timer x ( CPU Frequency / Prescaler )

With:

  • CPU Frequency = 16 MHz
  • Your timer in seconds
  • Prescaler egual to 1, 8, 64, 256 or 1024.

For example, to have a 7.5 ms period timer, the delay parameter is egual to 65536 - 0.0075 x ( 16000000 / 8 ) = 50536

Parameters:
delay Delay (see formula to compute this value)
prescaler Prescaler value

void Timer1Stop ( void   ) 

Stop timer1 interrupt.
